did.unittitle: Lewis Friedman Collection on the United Federation of Teachers
did.abstract: This collection consists of United Federation of Teachers (UFT) newsletters compiled by Lewis Friedman as well as several folders related to UFT leader Steve Zeluck. Lewis (a.k.a. Lew) Friedman was a United Federation of Teachers Caucus delegate and a member of the UFT board. He worked closely with fellow union member Steve Zeluck, organizing for the UFT and other anit-war and teachers' movements. Newsletters in this collection include issues of Another View (UFT-District 14, 1971-1974), UFT Delegate News (1989-1994), School Voices (1991, 1996) Chalk Dust, (UFT, 1981-1983) and a variety of other newsletters produced in the 1970s and 1980s. Materials related to Steve Zeluck include an assortment of newsletters, memoranda, flyers, and a folder of clippings and programs regarding Zeluck's memorial in 1985.
did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Lewis Friedman, September 2016. The accession number associated with this gift is 2016.056.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: At the time of accessioning materials were placed in new acid-free folders and boxes. Original caption information was transcribed onto new folders. In several cases original folders have been retained. Materials were described at the collection level, but materials have received no further arrangement or description.
